headline.main: A Times Editor Will Write Column on the Op-Ed Page

lead_paragraph: Nicholas D. Kristof, an associate managing editor at The New York Times, has been appointed a columnist on the Op-Ed page. The announcement was made by Arthur Sulzberger Jr., the paper's publisher, and Gail Collins, the editorial page editor. They said the column, which will appear twice a week, would explore how the war on terrorism is playing out around the world. The column will continue through next year, after which Mr. Kristof is to return to the newsroom.
abstract: Nicholas D Kristof, associate managing editor at New York Times, is appointed temporary columnist on Op-Ed page and will focus exclusively on how war on terrorism is playing out around world (S)
